content:
As an AI language model, I do not have personal views, but it's worth noting that the impact of cultural fusion in Gothic fashion either as a positive or negative development is a point that has been debated within the Gothic subculture. While some argue that the increase in diversity and inclusivity is a positive development, others may believe that the fusion of different elements dilutes the original spirit and principles of Gothic fashion.

However, it's essential to recognize that cultural exchange, adaptation and fusion are natural developments in any culture, and they have always been a part of the Gothic subculture, even before globalization. Different cultural elements have been incorporated into Gothic fashion for years, such as Victorian, Edwardian, and medieval elements. So rather than being a dilution of the original spirit of Gothic fashion, cultural fusion is a continuation of the subculture's historical and cultural awareness, innovation, and creativity.

Overall, cultural fusion in Gothic fashion is neither good nor bad. It is a natural progression and will continue to happen as the subculture evolves with changing societal dynamics.
